materials.name: Instructor Information
materials.description: Professor: Tedd Wong, Email: twong76@mtsac.edu, Office Phone: 909-274-4425, Office Location: 61-2505, Office Hours: 6:30 pm MW before class and 8:25 MW after class.

materials.name: Course Description
materials.description: Vector approach to static equilibrium of rigid bodies, forces, couples in two and three-dimensional space. Application of equilibrium principles to trusses, frames, and machines. Calculation of center-of-mass and centroid. Friction, moment of inertia, distributed and concentrated loads. Forces in cables and beams. Fluid statics. Introduction to virtual work. PRE-REQUISITES: PHYS 4A and MATH 181.

materials.name: Required Materials
materials.description: Textbook: Engineering Mechanics: Statics, by R.C. Hibbeler, 15th ed. Supplies: Standard note-taking supplies, a scientific calculator (NCEES/SAT/ACT approved), a straight-edge. Quad rule pad is highly recommended.

materials.name: Grading Scale
materials.description: Homework: 10%, Midterm 1: 15%, Midterm 2: 15%, Midterm 3: 15%, Project: 20%, Final: 25%. Scale: A (90-100), B (80-89), C (70-79), D (60-69), F (<59).

assignments.name: Homework 0
assignments.description: In-class assignment covering Chapter 1: General Principles, Scalars and Vectors.

materials.name: Lecture 1 & 2 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 1: General Principles. Chapter 2: Scalars and Vectors, Vector Operations, Vector Addition of Forces, Addition of Coplanar Forces.

materials.name: Lecture 3 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 2: Cartesian Vectors, Addition of Cartesian Vectors, Position Vectors, Line Force Vectors, Dot Product. Note: Holiday on Monday.

materials.name: Lecture 4 & 5 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 3: Equilibrium of Particle, FBD of Particle, Coplanar Forces, 3-D Force.

assignments.name: Midterm #1
assignments.description: Covers material from weeks 1-3. Consists of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes.

materials.name: Midterm Review
materials.description: Review session for Midterm #1.

materials.name: Lecture 7 & 8 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 4: Scalar Moments, Principle of Moments, Cross Product, Vector Moments About a Point-3D.

materials.name: Lecture 9 & 10 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 4: Vector Moments About an Axis-3D, Moment of a Couple, Simplify Force and Couple systems.

assignments.name: Homework 6: Equilibrium of a Rigid Body

materials.name: Lecture 11 & 12 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 5: Equilibrium of Rigid Body, FBD of Rigid Body, Equations of Equilibrium, 2 and 3 Force Members, Constraints and Determinacy.

assignments.name: Midterm #2
assignments.description: Covers material from weeks 5-7. Consists of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes.

materials.name: Midterm Review
materials.description: Review session for Midterm #2.

materials.name: Lecture 13 & 14 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 6: Trusses, Method of Joints (MOJ), Zero Force Members, Method of Sections (MOS).

materials.name: Lecture 15 & 16 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 6: Frames and Machines.

materials.name: Midterm Review and Project Introduction
materials.description: Review for Midterm #3 and introduction to the group project.

assignments.name: Midterm #3
assignments.description: Covers material from weeks 9-11. Consists of 5 to 6 questions to be completed in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes.

materials.name: Lecture 17 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 7: Internal Loadings.

materials.name: Lecture 18 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 7: Shear and Moment Diagrams, Distributed Loading, Shear and Moment.

materials.name: Lecture 19 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 8: Dry Friction, Wedges, Screws, Belts. Project Build & Demo.

materials.name: Lecture 20 & 21 Topics
materials.description: Chapter 9: CG, CM, and Centroids, Composite Bodies. Chapter 10: Moment of Inertia, Parallel-Axis Theorem, Moment of Inertia for Composite Areas.

assignments.name: Final Exam
assignments.description: Comprehensive final exam covering all course material. Takes place from 7:30 pm to 10:00 pm in room 61-2311.

assignments.name: Group Project
assignments.description: Final submission for the group project is due.

materials.name: Finals
materials.description: Finals week. Final exam is scheduled for this week.
